intro: Leuceres castellanus, commonly known as the Castilian leuce, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
